page.title: 13Farming-Dairying-Hillbrae
page.content: The farm of Hillbrae is owned by Mr J. Collie who farms a pedigree herd of British Friesians and all of his 250 acres is geared to producing grass, silage and winter feed for his cows. Mr Collie inherited the farm from his father who moved there in 1890. There are 75 milking cows and a pedigree British Friesian bull. The female calves are kept for replacements in the herd or sold to other breeders and the bull calves are sold to another farmer for fattening. As well as using a bull Mr Collie uses artificial insemination to intoduce new blood into the herd. Mr Collie employs a dairymaid and a tractorman to cope with the day to day running of the farm and employs contractors to sow the seed and do his harvesting.
